# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load R libraries
library(opalr)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()

#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the GLOBE table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_0 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0')


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1')


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_3 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3')

opal.logout(erasmus_opal)


library('tidyverse')

ROTTERDAM_0 <- ROTTERDAM_0 %>% arrange(id)
ROTTERDAM_1 <- ROTTERDAM_1 %>% arrange(id)
ROTTERDAM_2 <- ROTTERDAM_2 %>% arrange(id)
ROTTERDAM_3 <- ROTTERDAM_3 %>% arrange(id)

```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}

lsb_ROTTERDAM_0 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_0$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble
lsb_ROTTERDAM_1 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_1$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble
lsb_ROTTERDAM_2 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_2$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble
lsb_ROTTERDAM_3 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_3$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble

```

# Alcohol consumption subdomain

### **Variable label**:  Current consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_cur_0  
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant currently consumes alcohol or has consumed alcohol in the past 12 months.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Does not currently consume alcohol   
1 |  Currently consumes alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete      
**Harmonization comment**:   The study-specific variable is "Do you ever drink alcoholic beverages?" is used in harmonization. People who are currently at the same age as their answer to the question "How old were you when you stopped drinking alcoholic beverages?" were also coded as having consumed alcohol in the last 12 months. 
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
## Used 'startage' instead of 'ep_page' for consistency with SDC
lsb_ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_alc_cur_0<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==0 &(ROTTERDAM_0$startage - ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3b==0), 1L,
                                      ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==0, 0L,ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==1, 1L, NA)))

```

### **Variable label**:   Ever consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_ever_0    
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has ever consumed alcohol.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |   Never consumed alcohol  
1 |   Ever consumed alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete      
**Harmonization comment**:   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  df <- merge(x,y, by="id",all=TRUE)
  return(df)
}
#Reducing the table to the variables needed
alc_table_rotterdam <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(ROTTERDAM_0, ROTTERDAM_1, ROTTERDAM_2, ROTTERDAM_3))

alc_table_rotterdam$lsb_alc_ever_0 <- ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3==1, 1L,  # if currently yes
                                             ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3a==1, 1L,  # if in past yes
                                                    ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3a==0, 0L, NA)))  # if currently and in past no

lsb_ROTTERDAM_0<- merge(lsb_ROTTERDAM_0,alc_table_rotterdam[,c("id","lsb_alc_ever_0")],by = "id", all.x = TRUE)

```

### **Variable label**:   Frequency of binge drinking  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_binge_3  
**Variable description**:  Frequency of drinking 4 or more drinks in one day.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
1 |  0 to 3 times a month  
2 |  1 to 2 times a week   
3 |  3 times a week or more  

**Harmonization status**:  complete     
**Harmonization comment**:   The study-specific variable is "How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?". The study specific category "weekly 1 to 3 times per week" is coded under category 2| 1 to 2 times a week, of the harmonized variable.  

**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
table(ROTTERDAM_3$e6_EIAUDIT3)

lsb_ROTTERDAM_3$lsb_alc_binge_3<- dplyr::recode(as.character(ROTTERDAM_3$e6_EIAUDIT3), "0"=1L, "1"=1L, "2"=1L, "3"=2L, "4"=3L,
                                         .default =NA_integer_)
# 0 = 'never'
# 1 = 'less than monthly'
# 2 = 'monthly 1to 3 times per month'
# 3 = 'weekly 1to 3 times per week'
# 4 = 'daily or almost daily 4 or more times per week'
# 7 = 'dont know'
# 9 = 'missing '
# e6_EIAUDIT1
# 0 = 'never'
# 1 = 'monthly or less'
# 2 = '2 to 4 times a month'
# 3 = '2 to 3 times a week'
# 4 = '4 or more times a week'
# 7 = 'dont know'
# 9 = 'missing '
# e6_EIAUDIT2
# 0 = '1 or 2'
# 1 = '3 or 4'
# 2 = '5 or 6'
# 3 = '7, 8 or 9'
# 4 = '10 or more'
# 7 = 'dont know'
# 9 = 'missing '

table(lsb_ROTTERDAM_3$lsb_alc_binge_3)
```

### **Variable label**:   Current quantity of alcohol consumed per week (total)      
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_total_0  
**Variable description**:  Current quantity of wine, beer and liquor consumed per week.    
**Value type**: decimal    
**Variable unit**: drinks/week  
**Category coding**:  N/A  

**Harmonization status**:  complete         
**Harmonization comment**:  The study-specific variable "Do you drink other moderately strong alcoholic beverages like advocaat, berry jenever, campari, liqueur, vermouth or martini?" has not been used in the harmonization of this data schema variable.  


**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

ROTTERDAM_0$nb_beer     <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3d==1, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3e, 
                                 ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3d==0|ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3d==8, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_0$nb_whitewine<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3f==1, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3g, 
                                 ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3f==0|ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3f==8, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_0$nb_redwine  <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3h==1, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3i, 
                                 ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3h==0|ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3h==8, 0L, NA))
ROTTERDAM_0$nb_liq      <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3n==1, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3o, 
                                 ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3n==0|ROTTERDAM_0$ep_lf3n==8, 0L, NA))
  
lsb_ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_alc_total_0 <- with(ROTTERDAM_0, nb_beer+nb_whitewine+nb_redwine+nb_liq)

```

ROTTERDAM_1$nb_liq      <-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didli==1, ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didlifr, 
                                 ifelse(ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didli==0|ROTTERDAM_1$e4_didli==8, 0L, NA))
  
lsb_ROTTERDAM_1$lsb_alc_total_1 <- with(ROTTERDAM_1, nb_beer+nb_whitewine+nb_redwine+nb_liq)

### **Variable label**:  Average walking time     
**Variable name**:   lsb_pa_walk_time_0  
**Variable description**:  Average time the participant spends walking per day.    
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Less than 30 minutes  
1 |  30 minutes but less than 1 hour  
2 |  1 hour but less than 2 hours
3 |  2 hours but less than 4 hours  
4 |  4 hours or more  

**Harmonization status**:  complete      
**Harmonization comment**: Two study-specific variables: "How much time do you usually spend walking per week in the winter? With walking we mean all kind of walking, including walking to go shopping." and "How much time do you usually spend walking per week in the summer? With walking we mean all kind of walking, including walking to go shopping." were used to harmonize the DataSchema variable. The average of these study-specific variables was taken. 
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
# 99.99 is not listed as missing. Is it correct?

ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalkwm1<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalkwm==99.99, NA, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalkwm)
ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalksm1<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalksm==99.99, NA, ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalksm)

ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0 <-(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalkwm1+ROTTERDAM_0$ep_piwalksm1)/2  
lsb_ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0<-ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0<0.5, 0L,
                                       ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0>=0.5 &ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0<1,1L,
                                           ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0>=1 &ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0<2,2L,
                                                  ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0>=2 &ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0<4,3L,
                                                         ifelse(ROTTERDAM_0$lsb_pa_walk_time_0>=4,4L, NA)))))

```
